THE FORD FOUNDATION

Mr. Frank 8. ichooley, President

Ik Gregory Mail
Urbans, Illinois
Dear Mr. Schooley:
I wish to refer to ay letter of June 27, 195f, in which
I advised you that The Fbrd Foundation bad approved a grant of
$97*000 to the national Association of Educational Broadcasters
to support projects in the further professional development of
education by television and radio. The grant supplemented a previous
Foundation grant in the amount of $94,000 made for this project, of
which you were advised by ay letter of my 21, 1956. It we® made
in support of activities of the fiscal year 1957-1956.
I sub new pleased to advise you that, in response to your
letter® of March 30 and April 27# 1959 to Mr, James W. Am—y of
the Foundation staff, the terms of this grant have been modified,
extending the period of the grant for approximately two years
beyond the original termination date so that the funds my be used
during the fiscal year 1959-1960.
All other terms and conditions of the grant remain
unchanged from those set forth in my letter of 27, 1957.
cct Mr. Harry J, Skomia
